result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Izayah M Rucker

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Izayah M Rucker in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Izayah M Rucker.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Status conference held. Defense has discovery and the State is sending an offer today. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on August 31st, 2022

Defendant Izayah M Rucker in court.  Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court for Izayah M Rucker.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a calendar call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Court cancelled stayed bench warrant. Defense requests time to review case materials with their client.
Case adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney John Mathew Krejci in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
Case in court for status conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered case adjourned for calendar call in Branch 37.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Calendar call scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Izayah M Rucker in court without counsel.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waiting for SPD counsel to be appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.   This hearing may be streamed live on Dacast at the Court's discretion:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Izayah M Rucker in court without counsel.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Izayah M Rucker appeared by video means. Defendant may qualify for public defender representation. Defendant ordered to Office of State Public Defender for reevaluation.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Izayah M Rucker in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for indigency hearing.  Defendant may qualify for public defender representation.  Defendant ordered to Office of State Public Defender for reevaluation.  Case adjourned for status of counsel.  Status conference scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Izayah M Rucker in court.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Izayah M Rucker appeared by video means.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Hearing held via zoom/DAcast. Matter adjourned in Branch 37.  Indigency hearing scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Izayah M Rucker in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/23/22 @ 2:30p
